metadata.title: CVE-2015-7763 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
rx/rx.c in OpenAFS 1.5.75 through 1.5.78, 1.6.x before 1.6.15, and 1.7.xbefore 1.7.33 does not properly initialize padding at the end of an Rxacknowledgement (ACK) packet, which allows remote attackers to obtainsensitive information by (1) conducting a replay attack or (2) sniffing thenetwork.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libafsauthent1 - 1.6.15-1
libafsrpc1 - 1.6.15-1
libkopenafs1 - 1.6.15-1
libpam-openafs-kaserver - 1.6.15-1
openafs-client - 1.6.15-1
openafs-dbserver - 1.6.15-1
openafs-fileserver - 1.6.15-1
openafs-fuse - 1.6.15-1
openafs-kpasswd - 1.6.15-1
openafs-krb5 - 1.6.15-1
openafs-modules-dkms - 1.6.15-1
openafs-modules-source - 1.6.15-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openafs package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.15-1').
